alternatives.transcript: Channel 2 WBBM television live from Chicago's Afternoon News team this is first edition good afternoon I'm Lester Holt and I'm Linda maclennan topping our news at 4:30 a major score today for anti-smoking forces in this country in his annual report the Surgeon General declared for the first time that nicotine is an addictive drug like heroin or cocaine the report has broad legal and health implications
as well as a possible impact on Tobacco sales and cigarette advertising

the idea that smoking is a drug addiction isn't new what is new is who is now saying it the Surgeon General there are three overall conclusions to this report first cigarettes and other forms of tobacco are addicting second nicotine is the drug in tobacco that causes addiction and third the pharmacologic and behavioral processes that determined tobacco addiction are similar to those that determine addiction

to drugs such as heroin and cocaine keup says like those drugs tobacco can cause mood alterations compulsive use physical dependence and withdrawal symptoms This legal drug kills nearly 1,000 Americans every day here's what the Surgeon General is recommending addiction warning should be added to Tobacco packages a license should be required to sell tobacco products he questioned whether cigarettes should be sold in vending machines where children can buy them and he says

is treatment for tobacco addiction should be covered by Insurance Coop's report is good news to anti-smoking lobbyists Patrick Reynolds the grandson of tobacco giant r.j. Reynolds is a non-smoking activist this report from the Surgeon General will ensure that smoking is not taking this lightly as it has been by the public it's the single largest preventable cause of death in the world today but the tobacco Institute says the report trivialize has the serious drug problem facing

it and it says claims that smokers are addicts defy common sense and contradict the fact that people quit smoking every day so far the tobacco industry has won every product liability lawsuit brought against it this report may change that Future track record many of the judges have ruled that smokers had a choice and they could have stopped smoking and the fact is it's not been very made very clear that smokers maybe didn't have as much of a choice in the matter as the tobacco companies
